meanings.definition: A deceptive or fake action or statement.
meanings.sent1: Her smile was a flam to hide her true feelings.
meanings.sent2: The magician's flam amazed the audience.
meanings.sent3: His excuse was just a little flam to avoid trouble.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises turned out to be a flam.
meanings.sent5: The fake painting was a clear flam to art experts.

meanings.definition: To make a false or misleading statement.
meanings.sent1: He would often flam about his achievements.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to flam about your qualifications.
meanings.sent3: She decided to flam about her age to seem older.
meanings.sent4: The scammer would flam unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The child tried to flam his way out of trouble.

meanings.definition: A sudden burst of flame or light.
meanings.sent1: The flam from the candle lit up the room.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks displayed a beautiful flam in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected flam startled the campers.
meanings.sent4: The flam of the explosion was blinding.
meanings.sent5: The flam of the bonfire warmed everyone around.

meanings.definition: To burn unsteadily or with a flickering light.
meanings.sent1: The candle would flam in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The campfire started to flam as the wood caught fire.
meanings.sent3: The lantern began to flam as the oil ran low.
meanings.sent4: The fireplace would flam on cold winter nights.
meanings.sent5: The torch continued to flam despite the wind.
